expressions.meaning: I'm trying to **get over** the flu.

expressions.example: 이 교통 체증을 뚫을 수가 없어.

expressions.meaning: How do you **get around** the city?
I need to **get rid of** this.

expressions.example: 저리 가! 나 좀 내버려 둬.

expressions.meaning: I'm trying to **cut down** on sugar.
**Long time no see**! How are you?

expressions.expression: It was nice talking to you.

expressions.meaning: **It's been a while**. How are you?
**Thank you so much** for your help.

expressions.expression: I hope you can forgive me.

expressions.meaning: **I see your point, but** I think differently.
expressions.example: 네 말은 알겠지만 나는 다르게 생각해.

expressions.expression: Can I ask you a favor?

expressions.meaning: **Do you mind if I** sit here?

expressions.expression: Let me know if you need anything.
expressions.meaning: **Let me know if you need anything**.

expressions.expression: Let me make sure I understand.

expressions.meaning: **What I mean is**, we should wait.
expressions.example: 내 말은, 우리가 기다려야 한다는 거야.

expressions.meaning: **It seems to me that** he's upset.
expressions.example: 내가 보기에 그는 화난 것 같아.

expressions.meaning: **From my point of view**, it's fair.
**If you ask me**, it's a bad idea.
expressions.example: 내 생각을 말하자면, 안 좋은 생각이야.

expressions.meaning: **To be honest**, I don't like it.
**To tell you the truth**, I forgot.
He **turned a blind eye to** the problem.
expressions.example: 그는 그 문제를 못 본 척했어.

expressions.meaning: **Keep your head up**. You'll be fine.
Just **keep your head down** for now.

expressions.expression: off the top of your head
expressions.meaning: **Off the top of my head**, I'd say 20.

expressions.expression: have a good head on your shoulders
expressions.meaning: She **has a good head on her shoulders**.
**On the other hand**, it might rain.
I **have my hands full** right now.
She **turned a deaf ear** to my advice.

expressions.expression: on the tip of your tongue
expressions.meaning: It's **on the tip of my tongue**.
expressions.example: 생각이 날 듯 말 듯 해.

expressions.meaning: It was just a **slip of the tongue**.
He deserves a **pat on the back**.

expressions.expression: cost an arm and a leg
expressions.meaning: This car **cost an arm and a leg**.
I have a **gut feeling** about this.

expressions.expression: from the bottom of your heart
expressions.meaning: Thank you **from the bottom of my heart**.

expressions.expression: let the cat out of the bag
expressions.meaning: Don't **let the cat out of the bag**.

expressions.expression: kill two birds with one stone
expressions.meaning: Let's **kill two birds with one stone**.
**A little bird told me** you got promoted.
He's the **black sheep** of the family.
I felt like a **fish out of water**.
He's a **big fish** in the industry.
Let's address the **elephant in the room**.
She's a **dark horse** in this race.
We could wait **until the cows come home**.
He called me **out of the blue**.
We meet **once in a blue moon**.
I **saw red** when I heard that.
I want it **in black and white**.
The test was a **piece of cake**.

expressions.expression: have your cake and eat it too
expressions.meaning: You can't **have your cake and eat it too**.
expressions.example: 두 마리 토끼를 잡을 순 없어.

expressions.meaning: Getting a bonus was the **icing on the cake**.
The new iPhone is **selling like hot cakes**.
The kids are **full of beans** today.
This is a **hard nut to crack**.

expressions.example: 그녀는 그에게 눈에 넣어도 안 아플 존재야.

expressions.expression: bite off more than you can chew
expressions.meaning: I **bit off more than I could chew**.

expressions.expression: take with a grain of salt
expressions.meaning: **Take it with a grain of salt**.

expressions.expression: have a lot on your plate
expressions.meaning: I **have a lot on my plate** right now.
I see him **from time to time**.
**Once in a while**, I eat out.

expressions.expression: put your money where your mouth is
expressions.meaning: **Put your money where your mouth is**.
We **hit the jackpot** with this investment.

expressions.expression: burn a hole in your pocket
expressions.meaning: Money **burns a hole in his pocket**.

expressions.expression: hit the nail on the head
expressions.meaning: You **hit the nail on the head**.

expressions.expression: the ball is in your court
cross that bridge when you come to it
expressions.meaning: We'll **cross that bridge when we come to it**.
I like places **off the beaten path**.

expressions.expression: at the end of the day
expressions.meaning: **At the end of the day**, it's your choice.

expressions.example: 안 하는 것보단 늦어도 하는 게 나아.

expressions.meaning: We need to **think outside the box**.
This is just the **tip of the iceberg**.
I'm not ready to **throw in the towel**.
You need to **read between the lines**.
I want to **turn over a new leaf**.
As a **rule of thumb**, arrive 10 minutes early.

expressions.expression: Let me bring you up to speed.
expressions.meaning: **Let me bring you up to speed**.
**To sum up**, we need more time.

expressions.expression: Let's move on to the next item.
expressions.meaning: **Let's move on to the next item**.

expressions.expression: I'll get back to you on that.
expressions.meaning: **I'll get back to you on that**.
**I'm writing to inquire about** the position.
**I'm following up on** our last meeting.

expressions.expression: Please let me know if you have any questions.
expressions.meaning: **Please let me know if you have any questions**.

expressions.expression: I look forward to hearing from you.
expressions.meaning: **I look forward to hearing from you**.

expressions.expression: Thank you for your prompt reply.
I apologize for the delayed response.

expressions.meaning: **As per our conversation**, I'm sending the files.

expressions.expression: I have a lot on my plate.
expressions.meaning: **I have a lot on my plate** right now.
We need to **think outside the box**.
You need to **take ownership** of this.
You need to **read between the lines**.
I need to **take a day off**.

expressions.expression: You've got to be kidding me!
Your guess is as good as mine.
expressions.meaning: **Your guess is as good as mine**.
**Speaking of which**, I saw him yesterday.
expressions.example: 그 말이 나와서 말인데, 어제 그를 봤어.

expressions.expression: I'm sorry, you have the wrong number.
Sorry, I can't hear you well.
I'd like to make a reservation.
I'd like to book a table.
expressions.meaning: **I'd like to book a table** for two.

expressions.expression: I'd like to confirm my reservation.
I'd like to cancel my reservation.
I'd like to change my reservation.
